intro: Quercus laurei, commonly known as the laurel oak, is a deciduous tree native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The tree has broad, ovate leaves that are typically dark green on top and lighter underneath. It produces small, cup-shaped acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Quercus laurei thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
